## Cultural Intelligence Report

### Business Culture by Region

West Africa (English-Speaking - Nigeria, Ghana):
- Relationship-driven: Personal networks > formal processes
- Aspirational messaging works
- Fast-moving market
- Esusu schemes deeply embedded (95% Ghana adults use Susu)

West Africa (French-Speaking - CÃ´te d'Ivoire, Senegal):
- Community focus, collective benefit messaging
- Government approval signals matter
- <25% have formal bank accounts
- Mobile money preferred over banking

East Africa (Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Rwanda):
- Trust-driven, value-focused
- Less bold branding than West Africa
- M-Pesa transformed digital economy
- Engagement metrics > conversions

North Africa (Egypt, Morocco):
- Islamic values, family business success
- Egypt: 170+ fintech ventures, Cairo top-3 hub
- Morocco: Gateway positioning to Africa
- RTL interface required

Ethiopia:
- Unique market, Ge'ez script required
- eQUB modernizing traditional Equb savings
- Digital lending 4x growth in 2022/23

### Advertising Channels That Work
| Channel | Best For |
|---------|----------|
| WhatsApp | All markets (98% open rate) |
| Facebook | West/East Africa (35M+ Nigeria) |
| TikTok | Youth reach, fastest growing |
| Radio | Rural SME reach |
| Football | Mass reach, trust signal |

### Islamic Finance Opportunities
| Country | Opportunity |
|---------|-------------|
| Nigeria (North) | 19 halal funds, N112B+ assets |
| Senegal | BIS targeting $350M MSME loans |
| Egypt | Largest population, fintech hub |
| Morocco | Islamic finance hub positioning |

### Localization Requirements
RTL (Critical):
- Egypt, Morocco: Complete UX redesign
- 25% text expansion vs English

Languages Priority:
- Francophone: French + Dioula + Wolof
- East Africa: English + Swahili
- Nigeria: English + Hausa + Yoruba + Pidgin
- Ethiopia: Amharic (Ge'ez script)

### Music & Sports Sponsorship
Afrobeats: 500%+ growth since 2017
- Tems: 1B+ Spotify streams
- Afro Nation Festival sponsorship
- TikTok challenges (CKay: 15B views)

Football:
- TotalEnergies: $1.125B CAF deal (2025-2028)
- SportPesa Kenya: Ksh1.12B, 18 clubs
- Community football: Cheap, hyperlocal loyalty
